result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter R Hemple was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI 9th, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Complete and perform any random drug/alcohol tests as required by the Department.  

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle T&R in defendants name as is defendant himself.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:30 pm 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Austin Mort. 
COURT notes PSI and questions if parties have received copies of PSI. Parties have received PSI and state there are NO corrections. 
COURT notes defense's sentencing memorandum. State notes it is in receipt of that memorandum. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: 10 years imprisonment - 5 years IC and 5 years ES - CONDITIONS of ES: absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; complete and perform any random drug/alcohol tests as required by the dept; no driving any motor vehicles; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept. 
COURT ORDERS: $2452 inclusive; any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 36 months, as is the defendant himself; 36 months dl revocation with administrative credit; AODA; DNA sample and surcharge. 
COURT orders half-priced IID. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 149 days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the deft is eligible SAP and NOT eligible for CIP. 
COURT allows parties to retain copies of PSI and advises parties to maintain its confidentiality. 
COURT remands deft into custody of the MCSD for transport to WI State Prison System. 
Adj: 4:18 pm

Sentencing
SEALED
Sentencing hearing at 11-06-2015 03:30 pm

Clerk Marisa/Kim.
Case Called: 8:45 am 
INCLUDES 15CF504, 15TR2771, AND 15TR2772. 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF504: Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>>D&RI. 
In 15TR2771: Ct. 1 (Drink Open Intoxicants in MV - Driver)>>DISMISS. 
In 15TR2772: Ct. 1 (Deviation from Designated Lane)>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 15CF504: Ct. 1 (OWI 9th)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed in 6 weeks time. 
Argued Sentencing set for 11/6/2015 at 3:30 pm in Br. 3. 
Bond Continues.
